channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Uniqueness theorem for completely non-degenerate B-groups
item.description: arXiv:2502.19685v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that a completely non-degenerate B-group is uniquely determined by its factor: two such groups with conformally equivalent factors are M\"obius conjugate. A similar property is inherent to the quasi-Fuchsian groups but not to degenerate B-groups. We also study the factor of a B-group as a triple: the main factor, the marked characteristic complex, and a homotopy class of maps of the first to the second one.
item.dc:creator: A. A. Glutsyuk, Yu. S. Ilyashenko

item.title: Classification of simple quandles of small order
item.description: arXiv:2501.06791v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article, we define quasiprimitive quandles and describe them with the help of quasiprimitive permutation groups. As a consequence, we enumerate finite non-affine simple quandles up to order $4096$.
item.dc:creator: Dilpreet Kaur, Pushpendra Singh

item.title: Higher-rank GBS groups: non-positive curvature and biautomaticity
item.description: arXiv:2502.06974v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We characterise when a rank $n$ generalised Baumslag-Solitar group is CAT(0) and when it is biautomatic.
item.dc:creator: Sam Shepherd, Motiejus Valiunas

item.title: Fourier transforms and iterated function systems
item.description: arXiv:2311.00585v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We discuss the problem of bounding the Fourier transforms of stationary measures of iterated function systems (IFSs) and how the pseudo-randomness of the IFS either due to arithmetic, algebraic or geometric reasons is reflected in the behaviour of the Fourier transform. We outline various methods that have been built to estimate the Fourier transform of stationary measures arising e.g. from thermodynamical formalism, additive combinatorics, random walks on groups and hyperbolic dynamics. Open problems, prospects and recent links to quantum chaos are also highlighted.
item.dc:creator: Tuomas Sahlsten

item.title: Algebraic Adversarial Attacks on Integrated Gradients
item.description: arXiv:2407.16233v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Adversarial attacks on explainability models have drastic consequences when explanations are used to understand the reasoning of neural networks in safety critical systems. Path methods are one such class of attribution methods susceptible to adversarial attacks. Adversarial learning is typically phrased as a constrained optimisation problem. In this work, we propose algebraic adversarial examples and study the conditions under which one can generate adversarial examples for integrated gradients. Algebraic adversarial examples provide a mathematically tractable approach to adversarial examples.
item.dc:creator: Lachlan Simpson, Federico Costanza, Kyle Millar, Adriel Cheng, Cheng-Chew Lim, Hong Gunn Chew
